title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First Point

Philosophy: Earned for correct Midpoint Riemann sum, with appropriate values taken from the table.

Need to see sum of two terms, each as a product of two factors, i.e. base 1  ⋅  height 1  +  base 2  ⋅  height 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5DE0@

p ( 4 ) ⋅ ( 8−0 )+p ( 12 ) ⋅ ( 16−8 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@579E@ or p ( 3 ) ⋅ ( 6 )+p ( 9 ) ⋅ ( 6 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@52D6@ earns first point.

If at least three of the four base/height values are correct in the sum of products, the expression earns the first point.

Second Point

280 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaaGioaiaaicdaaaa@3B34@ or equivalent

Can be earned without first point with Riemann sum setup demonstration. With credible evidence that a midpoint Riemann sum attempt was made without not enough work shown, this point can be earned in the presence of the correct answer. For example, a sum of two terms with no evidence of products ( 72+208 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F1C@ or a graph with areas labeled and summed to 280 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaaGioaiaaicdaaaa@3B34@ or equivalent, can earn this point.

Examples:

· 280=72+208 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40D1@ by itself earns second point, not first point

· 280 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaaGioaiaaicdaaaa@3B34@ declared, with 9 ⋅ 8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI5aGaaGjbVlabgwSixlaaysW7caaI4aaaaa@3FE5@ and 26 ⋅ 8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@409E@ identified (perhaps graphically) earns second point, not first point

· k( 9 ⋅ 8+26 ⋅ 8 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B92@ nonzero constant k≠1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGRbGaeyiyIKRaaGymaaaa@3C6E@ by itself earns first point, not second point

· p ( 4 ) ⋅ ( 8 )+p ( 12 ) ⋅ ( 16−8 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@55F7@ by itself earns first point, not second point

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First Point

Philosophy: Earned for correct difference quotient, with appropriate values from the table.

Need to see both a difference and a quotient

p ( 12 )−p ( 8 ) 12−8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4776@ by itself doesn’t earn first point; however 26−16.5 12−8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4187@ or 26−16.5 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F1F@ by itself earns first point

Second Point

Earned for correct units of ft per sec or ft/sec MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E52@ or f/s. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGMbGaae4laiaabohacaqGUaaaaa@3C3E@

Correct units must be tied to a number to earn second point.

Correct units must appear in part (b); correct units in part (c) only doesn’t earn second point.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Philosophy: Earned for correct p ′  ( 11 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8D@ interpretation.

Need two components in response:

· “rate of change of position” or “velocity” of the particle

· at t=11 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaigdaaaa@3C71@

Correct ways to describe rate at time at t=11 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaigdaaaa@3C71@ include:

· Rate at which position is changing/increasing

· Rate at which particle is moving right

· Instantaneous velocity or velocity of particle

Ambiguous/incorrect ways to describe rate include:

· Rate at which particle is changing/increasing

· Rate at which particle is moving

Units are not required in part (c). If units are presented for t, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaaiilaaaa@3AA5@ they must be in seconds.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First Point

Philosophy: Earned for correct Fundamental Theorem of Calculus application, resulting in a ⋅ p ( 8x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4514@ for some nonzero constant a. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbGaaiOlaaaa@3A94@

Ways to earn first point include responses of p ( 2 ⋅ 4x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44E6@ or p ( 8x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ECA@ (Note p ( 8t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EC6@ would also earn this point.)

The expression p ( 2 ⋅ 4x )−p ( 2 ⋅ 1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@50BD@ or ( p ( 2 ⋅ 4x )−p ( 2 ⋅ 1 ) ) ⋅ 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5868@ earns this point. The p ( 2 ⋅ 1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43E6@ is viewed as a chain rule error.

Any response correctly presenting and evaluating the derivative of the integral in terms of the substitution u=2t MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG1bGaeyypa0JaaGOmaiaadshaaaa@3CB1@ earns first point. Part of this response may include ∫ 1 4x p ( 2t )  dt = 1 3 ∫ 2 8x p ( u )  du . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5D84@

Second Point

Philosophy: This point is earned for correctly applying the chain rule to find h ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E0C@ or h ′  ( 1 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E7C@ That is accomplished by multiplying the term involving p ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E08@ by 4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI0aGaaiOlaaaa@3A6C@

Can only be earned if response earned first (FTC) point.

The first two points can be, and often are, earned simultaneously.

The point is not earned if the presented derivative is a ⋅ p ( 8x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4514@ for any a≠4.
